content: yarn café creations early spring a sock pattern by christy houghton copyright 2020 yarn café creations christy houghton all rights reserved in downloading this pattern you agree to print and use this pattern only for your personal non-commercial use you may not distribute or sell electronic or paper copies of this pattern you can contact the designer at yarncafecreations@gmail com early spring by christy houghton 2 gather your stuff pattern sizes this pattern is for women s shoe sizes 5 - 5 ½ 6 - 6 ½ 7 7 ½ 8 8 ½ 9 9 ½ xs s m l xl yarn needed color a approximately 50 grams/218 yards 60 grams/261 yards 70 grams/305 yards 80 grams/349 yards 90 grams/392 yards of a solid tonal or lightly speckled colorway in a fingering weight yarn for the body of the sock these are the amounts of yarn you will need if you are using a contrasting color for the cuffs and toes color b approximately 12 grams/52 yards 14 grams/61 yards 16 grams/70 yards 18 grams/78 yards 20 grams/88 yards of a contrasting color in a fingering weight yarn for the cuffs and toes optional recommended yarn yarn café creations biscotti sock 85% superwash merino wool/15% nylon fingering weight sock yarn color shown in picture early spring mystery sock set 436 yards/100g needles used four us size 0 2 00 mm double pointed needles dpns 5 - 6 in length and four us size 1 2 25 mm dpns 5 -6 in length you can also use 9 circular needles in these two sizes or 24 40 circulars if using magic loop method instructions are written for dpns you may need to go up needle sizes to obtain gauge notions needed cable needle tapestry needle stitch marker scissors gauge approximately 28 sts = 4 45 rounds = 4 gauge was measured in stockinette on us size 1 2 25 mm dpns knitting terms and abbreviations bor beginning of round co cast on st s stitch es k knit sl slip_stitch purlwise k2tog knit 2 stitches together sm slip marker p purl ssk slip slip knit pm place marker yo yarn over psso pass slipped stitch over knitted stitch special stitches cable 6 b c6b slip 3 sts onto cable needle and hold to back k3 from the left hand needle k3 from the cable needl notes this pattern uses an afterthought heel feel free to insert a different type of heel if you are comfortable doing so gauge is measured in stockinette stitch to give your sock more stretch around the top of the sock you can cast on your initial stitches with the larger dpns then switch to the smaller needles for the ribbing as soon as you start knitting section 1 the cuff using smaller needles and color b co 52 56 60 64 68 stitches and divide onto three dpns as follows size xs needle one 13 sts needle two 26 sts needle three 13 sts size s
